page.title: 05Kington St Michael
page.content: There are five more modern housing estates (approx.15 years old) in the village.Four of these are cul-de-sacs, and are called The Ridings,The Close,The Ham and The Orchard.The fifth is Town Close,which is a group of council houses. Most of the buildings in the village are made of either natural or imitation stone. At the south-east end of the village is Stubbs Lane.On the corner of this lane are the Village Hall,The Old School,and the Post Office.Here also are the Church, the Manor,and a little further down the lane,the Rectory. In the main street are also a pub, The Jolly Huntsman,a Working Mens Club and some very old (1675) almshouses. The village now has a population of about 700 people.
